alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 7:54PM MDT until July 26 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN EL PASO COUNTY... At 754 PM MDT, very heavy rain continues across the warned area. The public reported significant flooding just north of Truckton. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Truckton, Hanover, Yoder and Rush. Public report stated significant flooding in the Truckton area, encroaching on properties. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
